"Very well," she said, "I shall come."...and kill the
femme, she mentally added on.

--- robert riley <bustercross365@...> wrote:
> Organics/ Megatron Revived:
>  
> "Why thank you, kind sir," Organics said as she
> hooked her arm in Windlord's.
>  
> Megatron turned to Fortuneteller.  He extended his
> left hand towards her.
> "I think it best, if you came with us.  These ae
> dangerous times, no one can afford to be alone
> outside."
> 
> airly2000 <airly2002@...> wrote:
> Ydrassil/Windlord:
> 
> "Then Let's go"said the male and offering his arm to
> Organics while 
> Ydrassil shooked his head nad prepare to walk
> towards the base
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley
> <bustercross365@y...> 
> wrote:
> > Megatron Revived:
> >  
> > "Then let's go to your base.  I wish to speak to
> Rodimus Prime.  I 
> also don't like being under Unicron's ever watching
> gaze." the clone 
> said, dropping his arm to his side.
> > 
> > airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > Windlord:
> > 
> > "as I said"replied the male "Very risky... Rodimus
> have to take 
> the 
> > last decition about this point"
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley
> <bustercross365@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > Megatron Revived:
> > >  
> > > "But that was then," the clone said, raising up
> his right arm 
> with 
> > his fusion cannon,"This is now.  I am here, and
> some times one 
> makes 
> > all the difference."
> > > 
> > > airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Windlord:
> > > 
> > > "Very risky"replied Winlord"We barely could
> stand agains the 
> > > minions... they retreat'cause they decided to
> do... but with low 
> > > injuries"
> > > 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley 
> <bustercross365@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > Megatron Revived:
> > > >  
> > > > "There is a way to greatly deplete his Sweeps'
> numbers," the 
> > > Emperor clone said.  "I have yet to test my
> fusion cannon at 
> it's 
> > > full power.  In simulation, it has the ability
> to turn a space 
> > > colony to space dust.  I have many techniques
> and weapons that 
> > would 
> > > allow for what we need.  But I would be a
> diversion.  Someone 
> else 
> > > would have to slip in and find Malice.  This
> isn't impossible, 
> > just 
> > > extremely difficult."
> > > > 
> > > > Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > > Her jaw dropped again.  "This
> > > > is...very...very...unexpected.  If what you
> say is
> > > > true I apologize."  She gathered up her bolts,
> and
> > > > threw them again.  She saw that what they said
> was
> > > > true, and almost started to cry.  She had to
> complete
> > > > her mission.  She had to get back to Deus.
> > > > 
> > > > --- robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote:
> > > > > Organics:
> > > > >  
> > > > > "Yes, he does possess the untold legions. 
> We fought
> > > > > some Sweeps and their commander earlier.  He
> has the
> > > > > legions and the ability to create more.  In
> essence,
> > > > > he has an unlimited supply of Sweeps to
> guard him."
> > > > > the valkyrie said.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > > > "He's the size of a moon.  You would require
> untold
> > > > > legions of bots to protect even all of the
> obvious
> > > > > entrances.  And once you're inside the only
> unknown
> > > > > would be 'can they get to me faster than I
> can open
> > > > > the Matrix', which I think we can lean
> toward the
> > > > > answer being no.  Is there something
> essential I'm
> > > > > missing?  Or does he just have the
> aforementioned
> > > > > 'untold legions' at his disposal, in which
> case we'd
> > > > > be slag either way."
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- robert riley <bustercross365@y...>
> wrote:
> > > > > > OOC:  I don't know about you're faction,
> I'm not
> > > > > on
> > > > > > the Council.  As for going up to Unicron,
> it would
> > > > > > not be very feasible.  They need to blast
> INTO
> > > > > > Unicron, FIND Malice, and BLAST out and
> return to
> > > > > > the planet safely.  All things they can't
> really
> > > > > do
> > > > > > right now.
> > > > > >  
> > > > > > IC:
> > > > > > Megatron Revived:
> > > > > >  
> > > > > > "Perhaps you would like to show me an
> opening not
> > > > > > guarded and a time where he is not
> defended.  We
> > > > > > should wait and have him brought to us. 
> Much
> > > > > > easier, and besides, they will want to
> show off
> > > > > > their newest toy anyway." the clone said,
> drawing
> > > > > on
> > > > > > memory and the Matrix.  He replaced the
> artifact
> > > > > > back into it's place and his chest closed.
> > > > > > "Though I might have the raw power to
> blast in,
> > > > > > there are too many unknowns to go blindly
> > > > > forward."
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > "If you want to stop Unicron, why don't
> you just
> > > > > > take
> > > > > > the slagging Matrix to him, and open it
> like
> > > > > Optimus
> > > > > > Prime did?"  She had no idea why she was
> > > > > suggesting
> > > > > > that two such sources of Destiny energy
> wipe each
> > > > > > other out, but she doubted the Decepticon
> would
> > > > > have
> > > > > > simply be oblivious to the option.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > OOC: Has the council begun discussion on
> the
> > > > > > Deviner's
> > > > > > limitations, or is it just a big topic of
